Plot Heatmap with Quantile Breaks

Plot Heatmap with Quantile Breaks

# S4 method for bcbioSingleCell
plotQuantileHeatmap(object, n = 5L,
  annotationCol = NA, clusterCols = FALSE, clusterRows = FALSE,
  color = viridis::viridis, legendColor = viridis::viridis, title = NULL)

# S4 method for seurat
plotQuantileHeatmap(object, n = 5L, annotationCol = NA,
  clusterCols = FALSE, clusterRows = FALSE, color = viridis::viridis,
  legendColor = viridis::viridis, title = NULL)

Arguments

object

Object.
n

The number of breaks to create.
annotationCol

Optional. data.frame that defines annotation mappings for the columns.
clusterCols

Logical determining if columns should be arranged with hierarchical clustering. Alternatively, can define an hclust object.
clusterRows

Logical determining if rows should be arranged with hierarchical clustering. Alternatively, can define an hclust object.
color

Colors to use for plot. Defaults to the viridis::viridis() palette.
legendColor

Colors to use for legend labels. Defaults to the viridis::viridis() palette.
title

Optional. Plot title.

Details

This is helpful for more usefully visualizing single cell data. Ideas and code from: http://slowkow.com/notes/heatmap-tutorial/

Examples

load(system.file("extdata/filtered.rda", package = "bcbioSingleCell"))

# bcbioSingleCell
plotQuantileHeatmap(filtered)
